Vs30.NameToDisplay: Vs30 (m/s); preferred: default values used in OpenSHA

Vs30Source.NameToDisplay: Source for Vs30, inferred or measured; preferred: inferred

Z1p0.NameToDisplay: Depth to Vs of 1.0 km/s (km), preferred: default values used in OpenSHA

Z2p5.NameToDisplay: Depth to Vs of 2.5 km/s (km), preferred: default values used in OpenSHA

UpstreamDependency.Description: This method depends on "PGA [pga]", "PGV [pgv]", and "magnitude [mag]" from the "Intensity Measure" tab.

model_transition.NameToDisplay: model transition [km]: distance for transition between global and coastal model, default: 20

vs30.NameToDisplay: vs30 [m/s]: time-averaged shear wave velocity in the upper 30-meters

dist_water.NameToDisplay: dist_water [km]: distance to nearest water body

UpstreamDependency.Description: This method depends on "PGA [pga]", "PGV [pgv]", and "magnitude [mag]" from the "Intensity Measure" tab.

vs30.NameToDisplay: vs30 [m/s]: time-averaged shear wave velocity in the upper 30-meters

UpstreamDependency.Description: This method depends on "PGA [pga]" and "magnitude [mag]" from the "Intensity Measure" tab.

liq_susc.NameToDisplay: liq_susc: liquefaction susceptibility category (none, very low, low, moderate, high, very high)

Hazus2014_with_ZhuEtal2017.NameToDisplay: Hazus (2014) with Zhu et al. (2017) for liquefaction susceptibility

UpstreamDependency.Description: This method depends on "PGA [pga]", "PGV [pgv]", and "magnitude [mag]" from the "Intensity Measure" tab. Please visit the respective tab(s) and pick the model(s) to use.

model_transition.NameToDisplay: model transition [km]: distance for transition between global and coastal model, default: 20

vs30.NameToDisplay: vs30 [m/s]: time-averaged shear wave velocity in the upper 30-meters

dist_water.NameToDisplay: dist_water [km]: distance to nearest water body

UpstreamDependency.Description: This method depends on "PGA [pga]" and "magnitude [mag]" from the "Intensity Measure" tab, and "probability of liquefaction [prob_liq]" from the "Engineering Demand Parameter - Liquefaction" tab. Please visit the respective tab(s) and pick the model(s) to use.

dist_water.NameToDisplay: dist_water [km]: distance to nearest water body

liq_susc.NameToDisplay: liq_susc: liquefaction susceptibility category (none, very low, low, moderate, high, very high)

UpstreamDependency.Description: This method depends on "magnitude [mag]" from the "Intensity Measure" tab, and "probability of liquefaction [prob_liq]" from the "Engineering Demand Parameter - Liquefaction" tab. Please visit the respective tab(s) and pick the model(s) to use.

t_15.NameToDisplay: t_15 [m]: cumulative thickness (in upper 20 m) of all saturated soil layers susceptible to liquefaction (initiation with N1_60<15)

f_15.NameToDisplay: f_15 [%]: average fines content of the soil within "t_15" above

d50_15.NameToDisplay: d50_15 [mm]: average mean grain size of the soil within "t_15" above

w_ff.NameToDisplay: w_ff [%]: free face ratio (height of free face/distance from base of free face to site); for free-face model

slope.NameToDisplay: slope [deg]: ground slope; for ground (infinite) slope model

slope_type.NameToDisplay: slope_type: type of slope ("free face" or "ground"; default = "ground"

UpstreamDependency.Description: This method depends on "probability of liquefaction [prob_liq]" from the "Engineering Demand Parameter - Liquefaction" tab. Please visit the respective tab(s) and pick the model(s) to use.

dist_water.NameToDisplay: dist_water [km]: distance to nearest water body

liq_susc.NameToDisplay: liq_susc: liquefaction susceptibility category (none, very low, low, moderate, high, very high)

UpstreamDependency.Description: This method depends on "PGA [pga]", and "magnitude [mag]" from the "Intensity Measure" tab. Please visit the respective tab(s) and pick the model(s) to use.
This method depends on "PGA [pga]", and "magnitude [mag]" from the "Intensity Measure" tab. Please visit the respective tab(s) and pick the model(s) to use.

This method depends on "permanent ground deformation [pgdef]" from "lateral spread", "ground settlement", "landslide", and/or "surface fault rupture" under the "Engineering Demand Parameter" tab. Please visit the respective tab(s) and pick the model(s) to use.

d_pipe.NameToDisplay: d_pipe [mm]: pipe outside diameter - required for "level 2 and 3" analysis

t_pipe.NameToDisplay: t_pipe [mm]: pipe wall thickness - required for "level 2 and 3" analysis

sigma_y.NameToDisplay: sigma_y [kPa]: pipe yield stress - required for "level 2 and 3" analysis

def_length.NameToDisplay: def_length [m]: length of ground deformation zone (both clay and sand models) - required for "level 3" analysis

s_u.NameToDisplay: s_u [kPa]: undrained shear strength (clay model only) - required for "level 3" analysis

adhesion.NameToDisplay: adhesion: adhesion factor (clay model only) - required for "level 3" analysis

gamma_soil.NameToDisplay: gamma_soil [kN/m^3]: total unit weight of backfill soil (sand model only) - required for "level 3" analysis

h_cover.NameToDisplay: h_cover [m]: burial depth to pipe centerline (sand model only) - required for "level 3" analysis

phi_soil.NameToDisplay: phi_soil [deg]: friction angle of backfill soil (sand model only) - required for "level 3" analysis

delta.NameToDisplay: delta: sand-pipe interface friction angle ratio (sand model only) - required for "level 3" analysis

soil_type.NameToDisplay: soil_type: soil type for backfill to determine type of model to use - "sand" or "clay" - required for "level 1, 2, 3" analysis

weld_flag.NameToDisplay: weld_flag: flag for welding - "True" for welded, "False" for seamless or SMLS - required for "level 2 and 3" analysis

Return.Description: This method returns "probability of pipe rupture [prob_rupture]".

UpstreamDependency.Description: This method depends on "pipe strain [pipe_strain]" from the "Damage Measure - Pipe Strain" tab. Please visit the respective tab(s) and pick the model(s) to use.

weld_flag.NameToDisplay: weld_flag: flag for welding - "True" for welded, "False" for seamless or SMLS

ComponentDiameter.NameToDisplay: Component Diameter (in), used in O'Rourke (2020) and ALA (2001)

YearOfInstallation.NameToDisplay: Year of Installation, used in Hazus (FEMA, 2014)
